children.subject: For this semester, we borrowed the FPGAs from school, so they mailed it to us and we have to mail it back at the end. There's no circuit building; you just connect it to your computer and load stuff on it, but if you have problems, it may be more difficult to debug remotely (though this is true of any class).

history.content:
1) How is/will the FPGA lab be handled for EECS 151 for next semester. I see FPGA work a lot more in the embedded field than ASIC so I'm thinking I want the FPGA variant but it seems less attractive in the remote offering...

2) Workload for taking EECS 151 + lab and CS 152 concurrently? I would probably only be adding a P/NP course on top of the two.

Thanks if anyone has any insight!
history.subject: EECS 151 and CS 152
